todos.title: Innovation & Age
todos.body: Younger people, newcomers, and people with less knowledge are better problem solvers.

todos.title: Finite Triangle
todos.body: You can be smarter, faster, or cheat.

todos.title: Recording Ideas
todos.body: Vitally important.

todos.title: Break Rules (Cheat)
todos.body: To be a great problem solver you have to be a natural rule breaker.  When you get older you tend to break less rules.

todos.title: Cheating Tactics
todos.body: Take an extra turn, use other guy's assets, don't follow rule, define victory flexibly, and make it so you both win.

todos.title: Ambidextrous
todos.body: Switch hands to activate the other side of your brain.

todos.title: Solution Surfing
todos.body: Surf through pictures, tv, sounds, etc for ideas.

todos.title: Dwarves
todos.body: Sneezy (get it all out, vent problem), Happy (put yourself in a good confident mood), Sleepy (sleep on it), Dopey (be ignorant of something), Doc (get advice), Grumpy (find devil's advocate), Bashful (isolation).

todos.title: Simplify
todos.body: Simplify.

todos.title: Handkerchief Solution
todos.body: Mask (become anonymous), Gag (silence dissenter), Cover (cover object and describe it as solution, then ask person what it is), Surrender (to dissenters and offer compromise), Blindfold (listen to a proposal without sight).

todos.title: Ignorance Audits
todos.body: Learn more about your blindspot areas.

todos.title: Add Limitations
todos.body: Adding limitations can help you come up with radically new ideas.

todos.title: Combinations
todos.body: Adding ideas together.

todos.title: Need
todos.body: You will be much more inventive if your need is greater.  At a certain time when you are making progress cut off your retreat.

todos.title: Simple Solution
todos.body: When the solution is simple, God is answering.

todos.title: Humor
todos.body: Use humor to come up with radically new ways of thinking.

todos.title: Cerebral Sex
todos.body: Two way exchange of ideas.

todos.title: Computers
todos.body: They are useless because they only give you answers.

todos.title: Relearn
todos.body: The illiterate of the twenty first century will not be those who cannot read and write, but this who cannot learn, learn, and relearn.

todos.title: Motivating People to Do Something
todos.body: Tell them that their competitor is doing it.

todos.title: Generation Gap
todos.body: Speak to a 12 y.o. and a 92 y.o. about problem.

todos.title: Remove Safety Net
todos.body: Removing artificial zones of safety such as crosswalks actually made it safer to cross street.

todos.title: Traditions
todos.body: Remember traditions and norms are not rules and can be broken.

todos.title: Bigger or Smaller ' Sooner or Later
todos.body: Redefine the problem by making it bigger or smaller or the deadline sooner or later.

todos.title: Publish Goals
todos.body: Make signs in the office indicating your goals.

todos.title: Nature
todos.body: Look towards bugs and plants to see how you could solve problem.

todos.title: Imagination
todos.body: Imagination is more important than knowledge (Einstein).

todos.title: Ignore Old Answers
todos.body: Identify your top three solutions then set them aside.

todos.title: History
todos.body: History is a lie agreed upon (Bonaparte).

todos.title: Party
todos.body: Have a party or contest to solve the problem (with trophy).

todos.title: Change Location
todos.body: Go somewhere you've never been.

todos.title: Isolation
todos.body: Einstein did his best thinking in isolation.  Don't bounce too many ideas off other people.  Be wary of experts, they got their title from knowing how to play within the rules.

todos.title: Wasted Brainpower
todos.body: Don't waste the brainpower of the people in your organization.

todos.title: Create Symbol
todos.body: Create fake symbols and equations to solve the problem.  Like creating a fake machine or process.

todos.title: No Bad Ideas
todos.body: Christopher Columbus had the idea of sailing to Asia by heading West.  The idea was bad for it's intended purpose but ended up being one of the greatest discoveries of all-time.

todos.title: Tool
todos.body: Change the tool you use to solve the problem.

todos.title: Problem Solving Ideas
todos.body: Change definition, setup a test, improve motivation, identify and break rule.

todos.title: Idea Board
todos.body: Board of crazy problem solving ideas.

todos.title: Ask Child
todos.body: Ask a child how they would solve the problem.

todos.title: Hierarchy of Needs
todos.body: All problems exist within a hierarchy of needs.  Look to the higher level need to open up additional ways of solving the problem.

todos.title: Genius
todos.body: Ability to hold one's vision steady until it becomes a reality (B. Franklin).
